OYSTERS.Definition: a large flat sea creature that lives in a shell, some types of which can be eaten either cooked

PEARL.Definition: a small round jewel that is white and shiny (and that grows inside the shell of an oyster)

FELL COMPLETELY OUT OF FAVOUR.Definition: become unpopular with a group of people

SLURPING.Definition: drink or eat (something) with a loud sucking noise

SITTING.Definition: a continuous period of being seated, especially when engaged in a particular activity

PROSPECT.Definition: the possibility or likelihood of some future event occurring

ALE.Definition: a kind of beer, normally without fizz / effervescence

DRUMMING UP BUSINESS.Definition: encouraging the attraction of potential clients

ERA.Definition: time, a long and distinct period of history

HEYDAY.Definition: the height of power or popularity

SLIMY.Definition: covered with a thick wet unpleasant substance

STRETCH.Definition: a continuous area or expanse of land or water

BANQUET.Definition: very large meal, particularly for a celebration

BATCH.Definition: a quantity or consignment of goods produced at one time

CONTAMINATED.Definition: having been made impure or damaged by exposure to or addition of a poisonous or polluting substance

DIGNITARY.Definition: a person considered to be important because of high rank or office

TYPHOID.Definition: an infectious bacterial fever with an eruption of red spots on the chest and abdomen and severe intestinal irritation.

SEWERS.Definition: pipes used to carry away waste water

PRESS CHARGES.Definition: accuse someone formally of a crime so that they can be brought to trial

AMOUNTED TO.Definition: come to be (the total) when added together

NUTRIENTS.Definition: a substance that provides nourishment essential for the maintenance of life and for growth

TESTIFIED.Definition: acted as a witness in court

COMPENSATION.Definition: something, typically money, given to someone in recognition of loss, suffering, or injury

INSCRIBED.Definition: (of a surface or object) marked with characters

ON THE OFF CHANCE.Definition: if you do something on the off chance, you do it even though you think it is unlikely to succeed

CULT.Definition: a person or thing that is popular or fashionable among a particular group

ALLIES.Definition: the countries that fought with Britain in the First and Second World Wars
